prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories:
A US soldier, identified as Sgt Black, serving in South Korea for the Army has been apprehended in Russia as per US military reports. The arrest is not connected to political or espionage activities, as stated by the Russian foreign ministry.

Sgt Black, aged 34, was not on an official tour when he was taken into custody on 2 May in Vladivostok. At the time, he was in the process of relocating from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in Texas. Instead, he opted to travel to Vladivostok via China for personal reasons.

According to Russian media, his visit was due to a romantic relationship with a woman residing there. Melody Jones, the soldier's mother, confirmed this to CBS.

Sgt Black enlisted in the Army as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. Most recently, he was assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

The Army communicated to Sgt Black's family and the US Department of State is offering consular assistance during his detention in Russia. He was apprehended for allegedly stealing personal property.

The US is also dealing with the detainment of other Americans, including Wall Street Journal journalist Evan Gershkovich, who has been held since March 2023 on espionage charges, and former Marine Paul Whelan, who was sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020 on charges of spying. Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government considers the charges against them to be unwarranted.

A US soldier named Sgt Black, currently stationed in South Korea with the Army, was detained in Russia on May 2, 2023, in Vladivostok. The incident is not linked to political or espionage activities, as reported by the Russian foreign ministry.

Sgt Black, who is 34 years old, was not on an official military tour at the time of his arrest. Instead, he chose to travel to Vladivostok via China for personal reasons, including a romantic relationship with a local woman, as confirmed by Melody Jones, his mother, to CBS.

Sgt Black enlisted in the Army as an infantryman in 2008 and was previously deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He had recently been assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea, at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

The Army and the US Department of State have been informed about the situation, and consular assistance is being offered to Sgt Black and his family. The soldier was taken into custody for allegedly stealing personal property.

It is important to note that the US is currently dealing with the detainment of other American citizens in Russia, including Wall Street Journal journalist Evan Gershkovich, who has been held since March 2023 on espionage charges, and former Marine Paul Whelan, who received a 16-year prison sentence in 2020 on charges of spying. Both men deny the allegations against them, and the US government considers the charges to be unjustified.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US administration views the accusations against them as unwarranted.

A 34-year-old American soldier named Sgt. Black, based at Camp Humphreys in South Korea, was detained by the Russian authorities in Vladivostok on May 2, 2023. The Russian foreign ministry assured that the arrest did not result from political or espionage reasons.

At the time of his capture, Sgt. Black was not carrying out military tasks. He had journeyed from China to Russia to attend to personal matters, as stated by his mother, Melody Jones, in an interview with CBS News. There are indications that his trip may have been associated with a romantic involvement with a local woman.

Sgt. Black had joined the Army as an infantryman in 2008 and had previously served in Iraq (2009) and Afghanistan (2013). Currently, he was assigned to the Eighth Army in South Korea.

Both the Army and the American embassy have been apprised of the situation, with the consulate extending aid to Sgt. Black and his family. Presently, he is incarcerated due to allegations of larceny.

It is worth mentioning that there have been prior cases of American detainees in Russia. Evan Gershkovich, a correspondent for The Wall Street Journal, was taken into custody in March 2023 on accusations of espionage. Paul Whelan, a former marine, received a 16-year sentence in 2020 for suspected intelligence activities. Both men continue to assert their innocence, and the US administration regards the accusations against them as unjustified.
